intro: Habranthus concinnus, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and tubular, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom during the summer months. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
